test_description: Verify the Jint sandbox prevents access to the .NET CLR and file system (REQ-SEC-DTR-001).
business_risk: Critical - Sandbox escape could lead to full server compromise.
preconditions: The Jint Transformation Engine is initialized.
test_steps: 1. Define a JS script that attempts to call `System.IO.File.ReadAllText`. 2. Execute the script via the transformation engine. 3. Catch any exceptions.
expected_result: A `Jint.Runtime.JavaScriptException` or `SecurityException` is thrown. The operation is blocked. A security violation is logged.
success_criteria: Exception is thrown 100% of the time. No file access occurs. A security log is generated.
security_considerations: This is a primary security validation test.

test_description: Verify the transformation engine meets the performance benchmark of processing a 10MB JSON dataset with a 200-statement script in under 10 seconds (REQ-PERF-DTR-002).
business_risk: High - Feature is unusable for target datasets if it fails.
preconditions: A 10MB JSON test file and a 200-statement JS script file are available.
test_steps: 1. Load the 10MB JSON into a `JsonNode`. 2. Load the 200-statement script. 3. Start a stopwatch. 4. Execute the transformation. 5. Stop the stopwatch. 6. Assert duration is less than 10 seconds.
expected_result: The test passes, with execution time under the 10-second threshold.
environment_requirements: CI environment with standardized hardware (4 vCPU, 16GB RAM).
failure_impact: High - Feature does not meet non-functional requirements.

test_description: Verify the full lifecycle of a transformation script: Create (POST), Update with versioning (PUT), Read (GET), and Delete (DELETE) (REQ-FUNC-DTR-004, REQ-FUNC-DTR-005).
business_risk: High - Core functionality for managing transformations.
preconditions: API is running. User is authenticated as an Administrator.
test_steps: 1. POST to `/api/v1/transformations` to create a script. Verify 201 response. 2. GET the script by ID, verify content. 3. PUT to the script ID with new content. Verify 200 response and a new version is created. 4. GET versions, verify history. 5. DELETE the script, verify 204 response. 6. GET the script again, verify 404 response.
expected_result: All API calls succeed with the correct HTTP status codes and data modifications.
test_data_needs: Admin user credentials, sample JavaScript content.
success_criteria: Full CRUD and versioning lifecycle completes successfully.
failure_impact: Critical - Administrators cannot manage transformation scripts.
security_considerations: Tests must use a valid admin JWT.

test_description: Verify the real-time preview functionality with sample data, including success, script error, and timeout scenarios (REQ-FUNC-DTR-002, REQ-PERF-DTR-001).
business_risk: Medium - Degraded user experience for script authors.
preconditions: User is logged in as an Administrator and on the script editor page.
test_steps: 1. Enter a valid script and sample JSON, click 'Preview', verify correct output. 2. Enter a script with a runtime error, click 'Preview', verify structured error message. 3. Enter a script with an infinite loop, click 'Preview', verify a timeout error appears after ~30 seconds.
expected_result: The output pane correctly displays the transformed JSON for success, a structured error for script failures, and a timeout message for long-running scripts.
test_data_needs: Sample JSON data, valid JS script, JS script with runtime error, JS script with infinite loop.
success_criteria: All three scenarios (success, error, timeout) behave as expected.
failure_impact: High - Administrators cannot effectively test or debug their scripts.
performance_expectations: UI remains responsive during preview execution.
accessibility_requirements: Loading indicators and error messages must be announced by screen readers.

test_description: Verify Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) and audit logging for all script management operations (REQ-SEC-DTR-004).
business_risk: Critical - Unauthorized users could inject malicious code.
preconditions: Admin and Viewer user accounts exist. API is running.
test_steps: 1. Authenticate as 'Viewer'. Attempt POST, PUT, DELETE to `/api/v1/transformations`. Verify 403 Forbidden response. 2. Authenticate as 'Admin'. Successfully POST a new script. 3. Query the audit log database/API. Verify a 'Create' event was logged for the Admin user.
expected_result: Non-admin users are blocked from all CUD operations. All successful admin CUD operations are recorded in the audit log.
tools_required: xUnit with WebApplicationFactory, Testcontainers for MongoDB
success_criteria: All RBAC and audit logging checks pass.
security_considerations: Primary test for API authorization and auditing.

test_description: Verify the `/metrics` endpoint exposes correct Prometheus metrics and that they are incremented after script executions (REQ-OPER-DTR-001).
business_risk: Low - Lack of monitoring data for operations.
preconditions: API is running. A script execution has been performed.
test_steps: 1. Scrape the `/metrics` endpoint and store the initial value of `script_executions_total`. 2. Execute a script via the preview API. 3. Scrape the `/metrics` endpoint again. 4. Assert that the new value of `script_executions_total` is the initial value + 1.
expected_result: The Prometheus metrics counters are correctly incremented after relevant events occur.
tools_required: xUnit with WebApplicationFactory, Prometheus text format parser
success_criteria: All defined metrics are present and correctly updated.
failure_impact: Medium - Inability to monitor system health and performance.
